scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-34 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-34 is a star with 1.05 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.16 times its radius. It is located 5873.48 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-34 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-34 system


Kepler-34 b

Kepler-34 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2012-01, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 1.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-34 b is 69.960 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-34 b is 8.564 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, Kepler-34 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-34, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-34 - System With 1 Exoplanet
